issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: ELB access logging fails when DNS server is set to non UFS

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
*Assessment*

While confirming EUCA-12068, it was noticed that the ELB returned 503 service code during curl requests:
*Source:  External client*
{code}

*Signs*

The ELB covers two availability zones:
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# eulb-describe-lbs WebDevELB --show-long --region devops-admin@
LOAD_BALANCER	WebDevELB	WebDevELB-000884302249.lb.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com			{interval=30,target=HTTP:80/,timeout=3,healthy-threshold=3,unhealthy-threshold=3}	hood-billionaire,black-dollar	subnet-f3ce9346,subnet-05ae1229	vpc-9652735e	i-befe199c	{protocol=HTTP,lb-port=80,instance-protocol=HTTP,instance-port=80}					{owner-alias=000884302249,group-name=default}	{sg-fd182601}	2016-04-21T14:56:31.355Z	internet-facing
{code}
The nameserver that the ELBs point to is a non-UFS nameserver:
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# ssh -i elb-admin cloud-user@euca-10-116-164-73.eucalyptus.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com "cat /etc/resolv.conf"
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
nameserver 10.115.1.220
[root@c-31 ~]# ssh -i elb-admin cloud-user@euca-10-116-164-26.eucalyptus.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com "cat /etc/resolv.conf"
; generated by /sbin/dhclient-script
nameserver 10.115.1.220
{code}
10.115.1.220 resolves the ELB just fine:
*Source: CLC*
{code}
[root@c-31 ~]# nslookup WebDevELB-000884302249.lb.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com 10.115.1.220
Server:		10.115.1.220
Address:	10.115.1.220#53

Name:	WebDevELB-000884302249.lb.d-36.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
Address: 10.116.164.26
{code}

{code}

fields.summary: ELB with nameserver that isn't UFS causes 503 code

comments.body:
The issue appears to be not related to DNS server.

When I looked at the setup, I noticed that there are 2 AZs enabled for the loadbalancer, but there is only one instance registered from one AZ. Because CrossZoneLoadBalancing is not enabled, one of the loadbalancers has no instance and throws 503. When CrossZone is turned on, the problem is gone. If there is at least one instance for each AZ, the problem will be gone as well.

Depending on AWS's behavior, our behavior (throwing 503 for no registered instances) could be a bug.
[~hspencer] can you confirm my comment? I think 503 for no registered instance is the correct behavior and we can close the ticket.
[~spark], I will confirm later today, and respond.  Thanks for the feedback.
[~dmitrii], sure.  If I run into it again, I can re-open it.  Thanks.
